entry.title: mdturnerinoz/EclipseShowLocation
entry.summary:
Basic notes on how to make Eclipse show the project location in its title bar (on Win/Mac/Lin).

The Eclipse "-showlocation" startup parameter causes the current location of the workspace to be displayed in the title bar (status bar) of the Eclipse window.

The "-showlocation" option can either be specified on the command line when Eclipse is started or in the eclipse.ini file (which resides where the eclipse binary has been installed).

Command Line eclipse -showlocation

.eclipse.ini (in the same directory as the eclipse (eclipse.exe windows) binary resides)

Example eclipse.ini (note the first line containing "-showlocation")):

-showlocation -startup plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.2.0.v20110502.jar --launcher.library plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.win32.win32.x86_1.1.100.v20110502 -product org.eclipse.epp.package.java.product --launcher.defaultAction openFile --launcher.XXMaxPermSize 256M -showsplash org.eclipse.platform --launcher.XXMaxPermSize 256m --launcher.defaultAction openFile -vmargs -Dosgi.requiredJavaVersion=1.5 -Xms40m -Xmx384m

Example eclipse.ini locations by OS:

Windows c:\Program Files\eclipse.eclipse.ini

Linux /usr/local/eclipse/.eclipse.ini ~/.eclipse.ini

Mac /Applications/eclipse/.eclipse.ini
